findings.description: The enterMarkets function allows ANY user to list ANY token as a market by setting markets[vTokens[i]].isListed = true.
findings.reasoning: While this is a valid concern, it is not the target vulnerability of price oracle manipulation.

findings.description: The borrow function declares totalCollateralValue = 0 but never calculates the actual total collateral value of the borrower.
findings.reasoning: This is a valid concern, but it is not the target vulnerability of price oracle manipulation.

findings.description: The borrow function transfers tokens to the borrower (IERC20(borrowToken).transfer) AFTER updating the borrow balance.
findings.reasoning: This is a valid concern, but it is not the target vulnerability of price oracle manipulation.

target_assessment.type_match_reasoning: The target vulnerability of price oracle manipulation was not mentioned in any of the findings.

notes: The audit findings did not identify the target vulnerability of price oracle manipulation. However, they did identify several other valid concerns in the smart contract.
